item.title: Jake add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jake add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is awfully easy to be hard-boiled about everything in the daytime, but at night it is another thing." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jake add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jake add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jake add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jake add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jake add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "I'm only interested in stories that are about the crushing of the human heart." -- Richard Yates

item.title: Jake add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "The greater the ambiguity, the greater the pleasure." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Jake add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Jake add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Jake add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "...in this ocean of hours I'm all the time drinking..." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Jake add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Beauty is truth, truth beauty,â€”that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know" -- John Keats

item.title: Jake add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Jake add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man grows used to everything, the scoundrel!" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Jake add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jake add a quote by Larry McMurtry
item.description: "Maybe you can make art out of unredeemed pain, but only if you're a genius -- Dostoyevsky perhaps." -- Larry McMurtry

item.title: Jake add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "Champagne for my real friends and real pain for my sham friends." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Jake add a quote by tom waits
item.description: "Not the kind of wheel you fall asleep at." -- tom waits

item.title: Jake add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jake add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jake add a quote by William Shakespeare
